dct_description_sm: Relief shown pictorially. California shown as a peninsula with a westward slanting coastline. First printed map devoted to California and the Southwest. Depicts many fabled places, including the seven cities of Cibola (Septem ciuitatum Patria). No other states are known.
From his “Descriptionis Ptolemaicae Augmentum”, the first atlas on America.
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Glen McLaughlin Map Collection of California as an Island courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
